text:
India’s biggest energy explorer, Oil and Natural Gas Corporation Ltd. (ONGC) is expected to report its lowest second quarter revenue in five years, with the Bloomberg consensus estimate pegging the figure at Rs 18,221 crore.
















The picture is not that gloomy on a standalone basis though. The state-run oil and gas producer is expected to see a marginal rise in revenue and net profit – 3 percent and 2 percent respectively, on a quarter-on-quarter basis. Earnings before interest, tax and depreciation and amortisation is expected to rise 11 percent with the cost control measures initiated in the first quarter expected to start yielding results.
















According to most brokerages, ONGC’s net realisation and oil and gas volumes are expected to remain flat quarter-on-quarter.

title: ONGC May Lose Some Steam In The Second Quarter
